bug.author: Mithzyl
bug.summary: utils.py: list index out of range
bug.description:
If this is a custom training question we suggest you include your train*.jpg, test*.jpg and results.png figures. <denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
A clear and concise description of what the bug is. IndexError occured in utils.py when running train.py <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
REQUIRED: Code to reproduce your issue below <denchmark-code>python3 train.py --adam --epochs 5 --weights '' --single-cls --batch-size 4 --cfg 'cfg/yolov3-tiny-1cls.cfg' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21375370/83050530-4ceb4800-a07f-11ea-8781-73e3917d87b3.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Train normally <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
OS: Macos, windows10 Both cpu and 2080Ti
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
I think it happened because there is an issue of my own dataset, but i don't know how to locate it. and when using the old version which doesn't contain output_to_target function, everything worked fine.

comments.comment: Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Mithzyl>@Mithzyl</denchmark-link> , thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data>Custom Training Tutorial</denchmark-link> to get started, and see our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb>Google Colab Notebook</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3>Docker Image</denchmark-link> , and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart>GCP Quickstart Guide</denchmark-link> for example environments. If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and minimum viable code to reproduce your issue, otherwise we can not help you.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Mithzyl>@Mithzyl</denchmark-link> your error is not reproducible on coco64.data. Ergo the problem is on your side, either in your data or in your enviroment. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26833433/83053883-4f5d8b80-a006-11ea-83f8-5423c9141282.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/glenn-jocher>@glenn-jocher</denchmark-link> thanks for helping, it occurred because of my wrong code.thanks anyway
I have the same problem. How did you solve it

I have the same problem. How did you solve it
make sure the number of classes in your *.data and *.names and .cfg files are correct .
